description: From Middle French légiste, from Medieval Latin lēgista, from Latin lex (“law”). Compare legal.

examples: There were a number of lawyers of the older type, men in sharp contrast and antagonism to the younger legists of the new American school.

entries.meaning: A writer on law, a legislator, a lawmaker
examples: ‘King and kingdom,’ concurred d'Aguesseau, wisest of wise eighteenth-century legists, ‘form a single entity.’
